summary.intent: Address merge conflicts with main branch and respond to PR review feedback about git show-ref error handling.
summary.outcome: Successfully merged main branch (no actual conflicts), fixed exit code handling in git show-ref calls to distinguish between 'ref not found' (exit 1) and fatal errors (exit 128+), and replied to review thread.

repo: The codebase uses git show-ref for reference checking and needs proper exit code handling
PR workflow involves cursor[bot] automated reviews that catch error handling edge cases

code.finding: git show-ref returns exit code 1 when a ref is not found (expected case) vs exit code 128+ for fatal errors - must use exec.ExitError to distinguish between these cases

workflow: Always check git status and attempt merge before assuming conflicts exist based on user report
After rebase, review thread comment IDs may need to be re-fetched
Full test suite should be run after both merge and exit code logic changes

friction: User reported merge conflicts but none actually existed - required manual verification
Had to re-fetch comment threads after rebase to ensure correct comment ID for reply
open_items: PR is ready but not yet marked for review - waiting for user confirmation to proceed
